result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Levell Pole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with case 15CF340.  
PROBATION REVIEW hearing December 18, 2015 at 1:30 in Br. 36

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharges plus all other costs and surcharges.  All bail on deposit to apply.  Remainder to be paid during probation. If not paid, a civil judgment will be entered.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim that rises to the level of probable cause.  Defendant is not allowed to reside in the home unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Levell Pole

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Determinate of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for ERP (WSAP) eligibility.
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING, commencing 9/10/15, received and filed. (43 Pages.)

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The victim is in court and requesting that the no violent contact order be removed completely and allow the defendant to move back in the house.
The court grants her request.  Defendant may live in the home.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
No Written Explanation sheet in file, programs not address on entry.

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are in court for a plea and sentencing hearing.
Received and filed:
Sentencing documents.
On state's motion the "Repeater" enhancer is dismissed outright.
As to count 1 as amended:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 1:  
  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by: Incemmira P.
.The Court sentenced the defendant to serve an indeterminate term of NOT MORE THAN 48 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons with Dodge Correctional Institution designated as the reception center with credit for -0- days time served.  Court ordered the initial confinement time to be 24 months and the extended supervision for 24 months, consecutive to case 15CF340.
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years, concurrent with case 15CF340,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim that rises to the level of probable cause. Defendant is NOT allowed to reside in the home unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surchargesl  All bail on deposit to apply, remainder to be paid during probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be entered.
- Pay supervision fees.

 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Maurice Levell Pole not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered that the defendant may ONLY have third party contact with the victim for the purposes of communicating/discussing medical issues surrounding the sick child.  Court ordered the defendant to have NO direct contact with the victim.
Statement by Incemirra P. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing however, defense counsel just became the attorney of record. Defense requested a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
for bail modification from the defense received and filed.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Violent Contact order. Court allowed victim to have contact with defendant while defendant is in custody. If defendant is release to convert to no in person contact, telephone and electronic only.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Maurice Levell Pole not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for scheduling. Defense requests a plea & sentencing date. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH PE for BRANCH 23:

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Original Information, received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms
Case spun to Preliminary Hearing Court.

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell via telephone  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mitchell is ill, unable to appear in court. Court found CAUSE and adjourned matter for Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid  prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Incemirra P

Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Maurice Levell Pole in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
